intro: Notylia replicata, commonly known as the common notylia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and showy white to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Notylia replicata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
